thread.title: Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO
thread.title_full: Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO

title: Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO
text:
Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO NDN-VIDEO-40122841865.mov Adele's new single, "Hello" (YouTube) Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO 
Singer Adele arrives at the 55th annual Grammy Awards in Los Angeles, Feb. 10, 2013. (Mario Anzuoni/Reuters) Adele releases first single from '25' — VIDEO 
Adele Adkins of Britain leaves the stage with her Oscar for Best Original Song for "Skyfall" at the 85th Academy Awards in Hollywood, California, Febr. 24, 2013. (Mike Blake/Reuters) Reuters 
LONDON — The first single from Adele's new album "25," a title she announced in a tweet earlier this week, was released Friday along with a video, the best-selling British singer's record label said. 
The single is entitled "Hello" and the accompanying video, filmed in the countryside around Montreal, was directed by Canadian filmmaker Xavier Dolan, whose films include "Mommy" and "Tom at the Farm," XL Recordings said in a statement on Thursday. 
It said the full 11-track album would be out on Nov. 20. 
Adele's last album, "21," released in 2011, became a runaway hit worldwide. It sold more than 11 million copies in the United States and was the best-selling album of the decade to date in Britain, according to industry statistics. 
Adele won six Grammy awards for "21" and an Academy Award for her theme song for the last James Bond movie, "Skyfall."
